contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date= October 2009}} {{Infobox French commune |name = Zoufftgen |region = [[Lorraine (region)|Lorraine]] |department = [[Moselle (département)|Moselle]] |arrondissement = [[Arrondissement of Thionville-Est|Thionville-Est]] |canton = [[Canton of Cattenom|Cattenom]] |INSEE = 57764 |postal code = 57330 |mayor = Michel Paquet |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = [[Communauté de communes de Cattenom et environs]] |longitude = 6.1336 |latitude = 49.4631 |elevation m = 220 |elevation min m = 200 |elevation max m = 395 |area km2 = 16.7 |population = 608 |population date = 1999 |demonym = Zoufftgenois }} [[Image:Zouffgen Gemeng w.jpg|thumb|right|270px|The ''mairie'' (town hall) in Zoufftgen]] '''Zoufftgen''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Moselle]] [[Departments of France|department]] in [[Lorraine (region)|Lorraine]] in north-eastern [[France]]. As at 1999 its population was 608. ==2006 rail crash== {{Main|2006 Zoufftgen train collision}} On the morning of 11 October 2006 a passenger train and a goods train collided head-on, killing six people. ==See also== *[[Communes of the Moselle department]] {{Moselle communes}} [[Category:Communes of Moselle]] {{Moselle-geo-stub}}
